To search for a Vendor or Bidder by Category Code, navigate to:

Main Menu > Search Vendor/Bidder

To create a PO using "Copy From" Contract, the Contract must be created with the Contract Process Option set to "Purchase Order".

To enable ""Copy From"" on a Contract not set to "PO" when created, cancel the Contract and create a new one with ""PO"" as the Process Option.

To create a PO (Encumbrance Only), to encumber funds for a non-procurement-related transactions, refer to Job Aid "Create an Encumbrance Only Purchase Order 7.0" at: https://fiscal.ca.gov/fiswp/?mdocs-file=2338

"Exceeding the grace period” emails are sent when reconciled P-Card transactions are in Verified status and the transactions are not yet approved.

It is also sent on approved transactions that have yet to be budget checked, failed budget check or have invalid Chartfield values.
There is only one level of approval required for P-Card transactions since there is no approval workflow process setup for the P-Card transaction reconciliation process in FI\$Cal.

To view Sales/Use Tax on P-Card purchases: Job Aid Fiscal.346 "P-Card FAQ", \#19 "How do I track the sales/use tax on my purchases paid by P-Card?": https://fiscal.ca.gov/fiswp/wp-content/uploads/docs/user-support/P-Card_FAQs_1.0.docx

Sorry I don’t understand your question. Please try rephrasing. If you’re looking for “how to” information, try visiting the job aids page http://fiscal.ca.gov/user-support/job-aids/. You can also get help from a live agent in the FI\$Cal Service Center. Phone: (855) 347-2250 Email: fiscalservicecenter\@fiscal.ca.gov Monday through Friday 7:30 a.m. — 5:30 p.m., Pacific Time ServiceNow is available 24 hours a day to report issues or make a request to the FSC.

To view changes made to a Dispatched PO:

Purchasing > Purchase Orders > Manage Change Orders > Review Changes

NOTE: the Change Order from the Dispatched PO must be "Approved" for the changes to display.

To enable a Supplier to do business with FI\$Cal departments/agencies: 1. The Supplier mails or hand delivers a hard copy of new or updated "Payee Data Record" form (STD 204) to each department/agency with which they do business. 2. The department/agency reviews the form(s) 3. Approved forms are securely forwarded (not emailed) to the FI\$Cal Vendor Management Group (VMG). NOTE: a current STD 204 must be on file at FI\$Cal before a PO, Contract, payment, or 1099 can be generated for a Supplier. NOTE: a TIN is either a Federal Employer Identification Number (FEIN) or a Social Security Number (SSN). NOTE: the name and Taxpayer Identification Number (TIN) on the STD 204 will be validated with the federal Internal Revenue Service (IRS). NOTE: if the IRS TIN validation process results in any discrepancies, FI\$Cal will contact the department/agency and the Supplier. Refer to Job Aid "Adding a Supplier Record" at: https://fiscal.ca.gov/fiswp/?mdocs-file=1849

To Budget Check a PO (or multiple POs):

*the PO must be approved
*all required Chart Fields (Appropriation Reference, Fund, ENY, Account, Alt Account, Reporting Structure & Program), in each line of the PO must have a valid value
*Miscellaneous Charges should be set to "Prorated Freight"

NOTE: A PO may be Saved even when it cannot be Budget Checked successfully.

To Budget Check multiple POs, go to: Main Menu>Purchasing> Purchase Orders >Buyer's Workbench.
"Awaiting User Info" means that the analyst working on the ticket has sent a request for additional information, which is required to fulfill/solve the request in a timely manner.

Department Authority/Designee" (DAD) is an individual authorized to request Roles, add/delete user accounts, and appoint/remove other DADs.

NOTE: Each Business Unit (BU) has a "Department Authority" and that person appoints "Department Designee(s)"" for that department.

To close a PO (and disencumber remaining funds): Main Menu > Purchasing > Purchase Orders > Buyer’s Workbench 1. Enter Business Unit (BU), Workbench ID, click Add. 2. Enter PO ID, click Search. 3. Enter Description, select PO Number, click Close. 4. Click PO Number in Not Qualified column. 5. Click arrow icon (to push to Qualified column). 6. Click Yes. 7. Click Budget Check. 8. Click Yes. Refer to Job Aid "Closing a Purchase Order (PO) to Release Encumbrance Balances" at: https://fiscal.ca.gov/fiswp/?mdocs-file=2298 NOTE: POs can be closed even if a Receipt or Voucher has not been created. NOTE: the encumbrance balance will be liquidated when the Budget Check is run on the closed PO. NOTE: if the report ZZ_ENCUMBRANCE_STATUS_NEW shows the encumbered amount > expensed amount, the Sales/Use Tax, misc. charges, or freight, was probably encumbered on the PO but not paid on the Voucher. To verify that PO(s) closed and disencumbered successfully: Main Menu > Purchasing > Purchase Orders > Review PO Information > PO

To enable Chart Fields:

If your Chart Fields values did not default in your entry, or you have not been provided the Chart Fields values to use, consult with your supervisor, manager or departmental designated super user.

There is no limit on the number of Proxies, including Approvers that can be added to a single Card Holder profile.  
To assign a P-Card Approver (or multiple Approvers) to one cardholder, use the Assign Proxies page.
This is a warning message. You should be checking the budget header status, and if it says "Valid," then ignore the message.
To request access to the UNSPSC catalog, please contact the FI\$Cal Service Center via email (fiscalservicecenter\@fiscal.ca.gov ) or ServiceNow.

To close multiple POs: "select a range of POs and close them all together" STEPS BELOW (1 PO) FOR MULTIPLE POS Main Menu > Purchasing > Purchase Orders > Buyer’s Workbench 1. Enter Business Unit (BU), Workbench ID, click Add. 2. Enter PO ID, click Search. 3. Enter Description, select PO Number, click Close. 4. Click PO Number in Not Qualified column. 5. Click arrow icon (to push to Qualified column). 6. Click Yes. 7. Click Budget Check. 8. Click Yes. Refer to Job Aid "Closing a Purchase Order (PO) to Release Encumbrance Balance 1.0." NOTE: POs can be closed even if a Receipt or Voucher has not been created. NOTE: the encumbrance balance will be liquidated when the Budget Check is run on the closed PO. NOTE: if the report ZZ_ENCUMBRANCE_STATUS_NEW shows the encumbered amount > expensed amount, the Sales/Use Tax, misc. charges, or freight, was probably encumbered on the PO but not paid on the Voucher. To verify that PO(s) closed and disencumbered successfully, navigate to: Main Menu > Purchasing > Purchase Orders > Review PO Information > PO Refer to Job Aid FI\$Cal.362 and Job Aid FI\$Cal.243 at: http://www.fiscal.ca.gov/access-fiscal/procurementjobaids.html

To view the Financials Worklist: 1. Navigate to http://www.fiscal.ca.gov. 2. Click on Access FI\$Cal. 3. Click on Access the FI\$Cal Application. 4. Click on Agree to terms and conditions. 5. Enter Username. 6. Enter Password. 7. Enter OTP code (if required for user ID). *The Employee portal opens (https://portal.fiscal.ca.gov/psp/psppd1/EMPLOYEE/EMPL/h/?tab=ZZ_FISCAL) 8. Click on PeopleSoft link on Employee portal. *The Financials portal opens (https://financials.fiscal.ca.gov/psp/psfpd1/EMPLOYEE/ERP/h/?tab=DEFAULT) 9. Click on Worklist link on Financials portal. NOTE: An empty worklist may indicate you are viewing a "Portal worklist." To receive Worklist Items: Main Menu > My System Profile. 1. Select “Worklist User"" checkbox. 2. Click Save.

To request an enhancement to FI\$Cal, complete a Request For Change (RFC) form, then deliver the RFC to your Department Authority/Designee (DAD). RFC Form: https://fiscal.ca.gov/user-support/fiscal-service-center/

To assign dual/conflicting roles to a single user, a Secondary ID is created. EXAMPLE: Processor and Approver roles cannot be simultaneously assigned to a single user ID. NOTE: Secondary IDs are identified at the department level via a unique email address. NOTE: To request a Secondary ID the Departmental Authority/Designee (DAD) submits a Multi-User Access Request Form (MARF) to the FI\$Cal Service Center. The FI\$Cal department does not manage the Advantage system. Any questions related to Advantage should be directed to your local IT department.

To resolve a ticket the FI\$Cal Service Center (FSC) will need:

*a detailed explanation of the issue
*steps required to recreate the issue
*relevant screenshots (including navigation or breadcrumbs) to allow the FSC to see exactly where you were in the system and what you were doing when the issue occurred
*Business Unit (BU) ID
*identifying information (e.g., Voucher ID, PO ID, transaction number, User ID , etc.)

To Budget Check a PO (or multiple POs):

*the PO must be approved.
*all required Chart Fields (Appropriation Reference, Fund, ENY, Account, Alt Account, Reporting Structure & Program), in each line of the PO must have a valid value.

When an LPA Contract has been selected on the PO, the Acquisition Type defaults to the Acquisition Type specified on the LPA contract.

NOTE: occasionally, a temporary server issue may slow the dispatch process. If this occurs, try waiting a few minutes and then dispatch the PO again.

To add Freight Charges to an encumbered PO requires a Change Order, re-approval, and Budget Check (to encumber the additional funds).

NOTE: The system will also allow adding and paying freight charge on the Voucher, but this will create a negative balance on the Encumbrance Status report (ZZ_ENCUMBRANCE_STATUS_NEW).

After paying for a P-Card transaction using the SCO paper claim process, the: Department P-Card Reconciler or cardholder will - 1. follow the P-Card reconciliation process, per Job Aid "P-Card Transaction Reconciliation Process in FI\$Cal" at: https://fiscal.ca.gov/fiswp/?mdocs-file=2182 Accounting Department will - 2. delete the system-generated Voucher corresponding to the P-Card transactions just approved and vouchered. 3. enter a comment about deleting the Voucher. 4. record the payment (P-Card expenditure) in AP using the second AP User ID.
"Exemption Code" is not a required field and may be left blank on a PO.

To view Event Approver(s):

Main Menu > Sourcing > Maintain Events > Event Workbench
1. Enter Business Unit (BU) and Event ID.
2. click Search.
3a. (scroll to right) select "Approval Status" OR
3b. (scroll down) select "View Approvals"

NOTE: To re-trigger the approval process, submit a new version of the Event.

To add multiple Chart Fields rows:

To a REQUISITION
> Requisition Settings
1. Select the Override box as default options.
2. Add multiple rows for Chart Fields lines in Accounting defaults.
3. Click OK (Chart Fields rows copied to all Requisition lines).

To a PO
1. Create a PO.
2. Click on PO Defaults.
3. Select the Override box as default options.
4. Add multiple rows for Chart Fields lines in Distributions.
5. Click OK (Chart Fields rows copied to all PO lines).

NOTE: Once approved, open the PO and set the contract version to the most recently approved version, and Save the PO.

To request a change, an SFTP request form must be submited by the Departmental Authority/Designee (DAD) requesting the change.

To print a Requisition:

Menu > eProcurement > Manage Requisitions
1. Search for Requisition.
2. Scroll right.
3. From the drop-down menu, select the View Print option.
4. Click on Go.

To edit a PO (Chart Fields) with encumbrance remaining:

NOTE: For PO payments already made, Chart Fields cannot be modified.

OPTION 1
1. Create a new PO.
2. Assign the desired Chart Fields to the remaining encumbrance.
3. Close the original PO to release the encumbrance. 

OPTION 2
1. Add a line to the original PO.
2. Assign the desired Chart Fields to the remaining encumbrance.

NOTE: an inactive Bidder assigned to an Event will result in the message "Bidder No Longer Available" and will prevent the Buyer from saving the Event.
To reset your password during login, select the “Forgot your password” link that appears after entering your username.

To edit a CSCR Event that has been "Approved" and "Posted" (e.g., change Event Date): Main Menu > Sourcing > Maintain Events > Event Workbench 1. create a new version of the Event 2. make the desired changes to the new version 3. submit the Event for approval *status of original Event is set to "Inactive", status of new Event (version) is set to "Posted." NOTE: the Acquisition Type cannot be edited if the event has been "Posted." NOTE: the published date remains the same as the previous version. NOTE: inactive Bidders must be removed and the Event saved, otherwise the message "Bidder No Longer Available" will result, and the Buyer will be unable to save the Event. 1. The request has been fulfilled and requires no further action.

When the "Allow Open Item Reference" checkbox is checked on a contract, the system will not allow more than one contract created for the same Supplier and begin date.
To edit a Department Authority/Designee (DAD), see: https://fiscal.ca.gov/fiswp/wp-content/uploads/docs/user-support/FISCal_DAD_PROD_v4.2.pdf

To create/alter managing accounts and cardholders: 1. Department P-Card Maintainer will provide new managing account information to FSC. 2. FSC will work with US Bank to add the new managing account to the monthly transaction file. 3. Department Authority/Designee (DAD) will request P-Card roles for the new cardholders. 4. Department P-Card Maintainer will update existing cardholder profiles or create new cardholder profiles for the new managing account and new card numbers in FI\$Cal. "Error Finding Worklist Item" message indicates that a Worklist item has already been approved.

To cancel a Requisition (or multiple Requisitions):

> Requestor's Workbench

2. select Search
3. select the ID(s) to Cancel.

NOTE: To release funds from a Requisition, said Requisition must be Canceled and Budget Checked.

"Approver" is a role in FI\$Cal. Access is based on the role set up in the system. Requests for access to FI\$Cal must come from the Department Authority/Designee (DAD). The form for this can be found at: https://fiscal.ca.gov/fiswp/wp-content/uploads/docs/user-support/CustomerSetUpForm20170629.xls

To resolve browser issues (choose one): INTERNET EXPLORER: press Alt+X to open your browser’s settings. Select Internet Options. Under Browsing History, click on “Delete" and check “Cookies and Website Data.” Finally, click on Delete. GOOGLE CHROME: Press Ctrl+Shift+Delete on your keyboard. Check “Cookies and other site data” as well as “Cached images and files.” Finally, click Clear Data. MOZILLA FIREFOX: Press Ctrl+Shift+Delete on your keyboard. Select time range. Check Cookies and Cache. Finally, click Clear Now. Additional information at: https://fiscal.ca.gov/fiswp/wp-content/uploads/docs/user-support/Browser_Delete_Cache_Help_Guide.pdf

To resolve P-Card transactions failing Budget Check, verify that:

a. ENY = current FY
b. Required COAs are present (see below)
b.1 Approp Reference
b.2 Fund
b.3 ENY
b.4 Account/Alt Account
b.5 Program
b.6 Reporting Structure (only required if department/agency uses transactional reporting)

DISALLOWED: approval of a PO by an Approver who is also the Buyer of said PO.

There are numerous reasons why P-Card transactions cannot be searched/viewed on the Reconcile Statement page.

* The search criteria used is not correct. Use the Clear button to remove defaults and verify the search criteria (use the Employee ID on the Cardholder Profile).
* The P-Card number used does not exist or was keyed incorrectly in FI\$Cal. Contact the P-Card Maintainer to resolve.
* The P-Card transaction is for a new Managing Account (MA).  US Bank does not automatically begin delivering statement electronically until they are ordered by FSC P-Card team.  Contact the FI\$Cal Service Desk and open a case to add a new MA to the P-Card Cycle.
* Proxy/permission to view the transactions does not exist. Check the proxies for "P- card Reconciler" for the card whose statement is being reconciled. Contact the P-Card Maintainer to resolve.
* Another Reconciler may have already reconciled the P-Card transactions.

The receiving tolerance is not a configuration item so a Department PO Buyer can decide at the PO ID level whether or not to check the checkbox for the ‘Reject Qty Over Tolerance field.’ If the ‘Reject Qty Over Tolerance’ field is checked, then the system will only allow the user to receive the quantity ordered. However, if the Reject Qty Over Tolerance field is NOT checked, then the system will allow the Department PO Receiving Processor to create multiple Receipt IDs against the quantity ordered or the service amount. The system is designed to leave this checkbox unchecked.

NOTE: If the additional Receipt IDs were copied to Voucher IDs by mistake, the new Voucher IDs will fail matching because the total quantity and/or amount received have already been matched to the first associated Receipt ID and PO ID. Recommend removing until the resolution can be verified and simplified.

To resolve P-Card transactions (offset associated/disputed) into one Voucher ID, the department P-Card Reconciler and/or actual Cardholder must reconcile and get approval for both transactions - on the same day. NOTE: If there is any difference between the total disputed charge and credit amount, only the difference will be paid to US Bank. NOTE: NEVER reconcile the disputed and credit transactions separately - this can potentially create a zero or negative amount Voucher. This zero or negative amount Voucher ID will not be picked up by the SCO Pay Cycle and will require additional work from the Accounting staff. Refer to FAQ\# 47 "I received my credit for the disputed P-Card transaction. What is my next step?" at: https://fiscal.ca.gov/fiswp/wp-content/uploads/docs/user-support/Purchase_Order_FAQs_1.0.docx

There is a maximum amount on the contract header. A PO cannot be created for more than the maximum amount of the contract. If a PO of maximum amount has already been created from a contract, then the contract would not be available to be copied into another PO. In this case, create a new version of the contract to increase its max amount:

1. Navigate to Main Menu > Procurement contracts > LPA/Departmental Contract Search.
2. Open the Contract in edit mode.
3. Click on New Version.
4. Increase the maximum amount and make any other changes as per your requirement.
5. Save and submit the contract for approval. Once the Contract is approved it will be available to be copied in a PO.

Sales/Use Tax is calculated on the P-Card Reconciliation page, as follows:

*if the P-Card transaction is linked to a PO ID, then the Sales/Use Tax info from the PO line will carry over to the P-Card transaction. 
*if the PO ID has multiple PO lines, then the system will automatically split the summary P-Card transaction into the corresponding PO lines, and Sales/Use Tax will carry over to the newly split P-Card transaction lines.
*if there is no PO ID, then department P-Card Reconciler must manually split the summary P-Card transaction into multiple lines. The Reconciler will need to include the unit cost of each line plus the Sales/Use Tax, and enter that amount on each split line. The total split amount must equal 100% of the summary total amount which is the original amount that came from US Bank.

NOTE: Sales/Use Tax that carried over from the PO ID or was manually calculated on P-Card transactions will not flow to the P-Card Voucher ID. All system-generated P-Card Voucher IDs are created as Tax Exempt.

To create a PO discounted amount with the Sales/Use Tax calculated on the original amount, follow these steps:

1. Create a PO with two PO lines.
2. In the first line put the original amount of the item and apply Sales/Use Tax on it. The system will calculate the Sales/Use Tax on the original item.
3. In the second line provide the discount given by the Supplier as a negative amount and make this line as "Item Exempt."

EXAMPLE: Your item's cost is \$100 and the Sales/Use Tax is 8.75%. The Supplier has provided you with a discount of \$20. Create a PO with two PO lines. Enter the first line as \$100 and the system will calculate the appropriate 8.75% Sales/Use Tax. In the second line put the amount as \$-20, and check line 2 as "Item exempt" (making line 2 non-taxable). The PO calculates Sales/Use Tax amount of \$8.75 and the merchandise amount \$80.

After paying for a P-Card transaction using the ORF paper claim process:  

Step 1: Dept. P-Card Reconciler or cardholder will need to follow the P-Card reconciliation process in FI\$Cal explained in the Job Aid, "P-Card Transaction Reconciliation Process in FI\$Cal" found at this link:  https://fiscal.ca.gov/user-support/job-aids/

Step 2: Once the system has generated the voucher from the P-Card reconciliation the BU will have to go in and check the “ORF Replenishment” Box on the Voucher (If the P-Card Voucher does not have any negative lines.) The BU will also need to check the “Automatically Apply to Prepayment” on the Voucher attributes page.

Step 3: The system will automatically apply the prepaid payment from the ORF against the newly system-generated P-Card voucher and pay US Bank the difference if other P-Card transactions were on the same voucher ID.

There are numerous reasons why P-Card transactions cannot be searched/viewed on the Reconcile Statement page.

* The search criteria used is not correct. Use the Clear button to remove defaults and verify the search criteria (use the Employee ID on the Cardholder Profile).
* The P-Card number used does not exist or was keyed incorrectly in FI\$Cal. Contact the P-Card Maintainer to resolve.
* The P-Card transaction is for a new Managing Account (MA).  US Bank does not automatically begin delivering statement electronically until they are ordered by FSC P-Card team.  Contact the FI\$Cal Service Desk and open a case to add a new MA to the P-Card Cycle.
* Proxy/permission to view the transactions does not exist. Check the proxies for "P- card Reconciler" for the card whose statement is being reconciled. Contact the P-Card Maintainer to resolve.
* Another Reconciler may have already reconciled the P-Card transactions.

To edit a Unit of Measurement (UOM), contact the FI\$Cal Service Center via email (fiscalservicecenter\@fiscal.ca.gov ) or ServiceNow.

To create a Receipt number manually:

1. Navigate to Main Menu > Purchasing > Receipts > Add/Update Receipts.
2. Click on the Add a New Value tab.
3. Enter the Business Unit.
4. In the Receipt Number field, clear out the value "NEXT" and enter the desired Receipt Number and click Add.

NOTE: the system will generate Receipt Numbers automatically, but allows users to create Receipt Numbers manually.

There may be many state employees with the same name. If this is the case, reach out to your departmental labor distribution team to confirm the employee ID for the P-Card cardholder in your department. This will ensure that the cardholder profile is created for the correct Employee/Employee ID.

To view Contract status:

Main Menu > Procurement Contracts > LPA/Departmental Contracts
1. Enter the Contract number in Contract ID field.
2. If searching for a LPA, select the "Show LPA's" checkbox.
3. Click Search.

NOTE: only approved LPA Contracts may be selected from the SCPRS Entry Page (see Knowledge Article KB0062064)

To approve a PO:

>  Approver Worklist
*PO must have a status of "Pending Approval."
*Approver should Budget Check the PO (to confirm the budget is valid).

NOTE: Approvers are allowed to approve a PO even if the budget has not been checked or is in error.
NOTE: The FI\$Cal Service Center (FSC) does not have the authority to approve departmental POs.
Disallowed: a PO cannot be re-opened once it is canceled.

To attach a document to an Event in "Posted" status, a new version of the Event must be created ("Open" status), see: http://www.fiscal.ca.gov/upk/PO383_v2.1.0/html/tpc/fcfa13b3-1079-40f1-9321-c935dbd02517/topic.html

WARNING: Sales/Use Tax (Tax ID) is determined by the "Ship to ID." Changes to the Ship To address may, therefore, cause a change to the default Tax ID.

Warning: A message appears when changing the Ship To address that it will also change the default Tax ID to match the new "Ship to ID".  You can click OK on this message and proceed with further processing of the PO.

To edit Chart Fields values on a P-Card with status "Verified:"

OPTION 1
1. P-Card Approver makes changes.

OPTION 2
1. P-Card Approver flips P-Card status from "Verified" back to "Staged."
2. Reconciler makes changes then sets P-Card status to "Verified."

NOTE: The Reconciler may only change Chart Fields values on a P-Card with status “Staged."

To resolve a PO with Encumbrance/Budget Status issues:

Check if PO budget status is in Valid Status or not. 

If budget status is not valid and unchecked;                                                                               

1) Budget check PO

2) Once PO has been budget checked to ‘Valid’ status PO encumbrance will show the accurate amount.

3) The Activity Summary can be checked on PO to see if any Vouchers have been created for PO and encumbrance balance is calculated accordingly.
To re-submit a Contract for approval, change the status to "Open" and resubmit it for approval.
To Budget Check a PO, the PO status must be Approved (not "Open").

To cancel an Event:

OPTION 1
Main Menu > Sourcing > Maintain Events > Events Workbench
1. Enter Event ID and click on Search
2. Click "Cancel Event"

OPTION 2
Resources > Statewide Procurement Training > Creating a CSCR entry OR Amending a CSCR entry
1. Create a new version of the Event

NOTE: a created Event may be canceled, however, the Event ID cannot be changed and the Event itself cannot be deleted.

To access the FI\$Cal newsletter: https://fiscal.ca.gov/library/focus-newsletter/

To view the header attachment:

eProcurement > Manage Requisition
1. enter the Business Unit and Requisition ID
2. click Search.
3. click on the Requisition ID.
4a. click on the Header Comments attachment icon to view Header attachments. OR
4b. click on the Line Comments attachment icon to view Line attachments.

NOTE: Requisition Header attachments are not visible from the Approver's Navigation page in PeopleSoft.
To assign multiple P-Cards to a single user, the department P-Card Maintainer adds each P-Card account to the cardholder profile of said user.
To view progress of an Identity Self-Service (ISS) ticket through the ISS website, refer to: https://fiscal.ca.gov/fiswp/?mdocs-file=2398

To Budget Check a Requisition:

Main Menu > eProcurement > Manage Requisitions
1. Enter Business Unit and Requisition ID and click on Search.
2. Select Requisition ID.
3. Scroll to the right and select the action "Check Budget" from the drop-down menu and click on the Go button.
4. Verify whether the Budget Check status is Valid.

NOTE: to Budget Check a Requisition in "Open" or "Denied" status, first re-submit the Requisition for approval.
